text.0: be friendly with each kindled log of fuel with every flash bestow the boon of riches.
text.1: bring thou the gods o god unto our worship serve wellinclined as friend thy friends o agni.
text.2: agni whom daily varuṇa and mitra the gods bring thrice a day to this our worship.
text.3: tanūnapāt enrich with meath our service that dwells with holy oil that offers honour.
text.4: the thought that bringeth every boon proceedeth to worship first the priest of the libation.
text.5: that we may greet the strong one with our homage urged may he bring the gods best sacrificer.
text.6: on high your way to sacrifice was made ready the radiant flames went upward to the regions.
text.7: full in the midst of heaven the priest is seated sirew we the sacred grass where gods may rest them.
text.8: claiming in mind the seven priests burntoblations inciting all they came in settled order.
text.9: to this our sacrifice approach the many who show in hero beauty at assemblies.
text.10: night and dawn lauded hither come together both smiling different are their forms in colour.
text.11: that varuṇa and mitra may accept us and indra girt by maruts with his glories.
text.12: i crave the grace of heavens two chief invokers the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner.
text.13: these speak of truth praising the truth eternal thinking on order as the guards of order.
text.14: may bhāratī with all her sisters iḷā accordant with the gods with mortalls agni.
text.15: sarasvatī with all her kindred rivers come to this grass three goddesses and seat them.
text.16: well pleased with us do thou o god o tvaṣṭar give ready issue to our procreant vigour.
text.17: whence springs the hero powerful skilled in action lover of gods adjuster of the pressstones.
text.18: send to the gods the oblation lord of forests and let the immolator agni dress it.
text.19: he as the truer priest shall offer worship for the gods generations well he knoweth.
text.20: come thou to us o agni duly kindled together with the potent gods and indra.
text.21: on this our grass sit aditi happy mother and let our hail delight the gods immortal.
